chargeHist.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denzel Equan Fowler

records.addlTxt: Attorney Sargent is unavailable November 10, 2022 at 9:00. Clerk rescheduled Scheduling Conference for November 16, 2022 at 8:30 am, parties notified.

Defendant Denzel Equan Fowler in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent not in court.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Attorney Sargent was in trial on a different matter and was unable to appear. Discussion placed on the record. Court ordered case adjourned, Branch 45. 

Scheduling Conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 9:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 10, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Denzel Equan Fowler in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Denzel Equan Fowler.  ADA Samuel Tufford appeared for Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Case is adjourned in Br 45 for scheduling.  mn
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Defendant Denzel Equan Fowler appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Denzel Equan Fowler.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Pittman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense Counsel requests an arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 45.
Arraignment scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated 09-06-2022; received and filed.

Defendant Denzel Equan Fowler in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
The Judge's explanation is outlined on the submitted order.  Duplicate.

Defendant Denzel Equan Fowler not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Abigail M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Denzel Equan Fowler in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Denzel Equan Fowler in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
